title: Olympia Visibility Brigade Overpass Bannering
description: We invite you to bring your high-visibility protest signs, flags, & a good mood to join us on the bridge to make good trouble.
raw_text:
OLYMPIA VISIBILITY BRIGADE
OVERPASS BANNERING

11 AUGUST 2025
FROM 4:30 TO 6:30

THE KISSING COUPLE
PERCIVAL LANDING, DOWNTOWN OLYMPIA

BRING YOUR HIGH-VISIBILITY PROTEST SIGNS, FLAGS, &
A GOOD MOOD, AND JOIN US ON THE BRIDGE
TO MAKE GOOD TROUBLE!

DEMOCRACY IS UNDER ATTACK
STAND UP FIGHT BACK!

MORE INFORMATION: BACKBONECAMPAIGN.ORG AND THEBLOP.ORG
raw_summary: The flyer announces an event by the Olympia Visibility Brigade for overpass bannering. It highlights the date as August 11, 2025, from 4:30 to 6:30, at The Kissing Couple, Percival Landing, Downtown Olympia. The event encourages participants to bring high-visibility protest signs, flags, and a good mood to join on the bridge to make good trouble. Additional information is available on backbonecampaign.org and theblop.org.

title: Corner Protest
description: We are organizing the Corner Protest every Tuesday and Thursday to engage positively in democratic activities and express our concerns about current issues. Join us to stand up for democracy at the southwest corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins.
meeting_location: SW Corner of Drake and College
raw_text:
Join the Corner Protest every Tuesday and Thursday 4:15-5:45 PM
SW Corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins
Positive engagement
PROTECT DEMOCRACY
Right or Left … we all know this is WRONG!
WE THE PEOPLE
OMG GOP WTF
Tuesday, August 12, 2025
4:15 - 5:45 pm
2601 S College Ave, Fort Collins, CO
raw_summary: The image is a flyer for a recurring protest event called the "Corner Protest," scheduled every Tuesday and Thursday from 4:15 to 5:45 PM. The next specific event date mentioned is Tuesday, August 12, 2025, at the southwest corner of Drake and College in Fort Collins, Colorado, with a focus on positive engagement and democracy.

title: Town Hall Announcement
description: We invite you to voice your concerns and have your questions answered regarding community and environmental issues by Commissioner Kowal and Rep. Benaroch.
raw_text:
ARE YOU CONCERNED ABOUT THE HAPPENINGS IN YOUR COMMUNITY
DO YOU HAVE ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS
WOULD YOU LIKE TO SEE POLICY CHANGES
VOICE YOUR CONCERNS & HAVE YOUR QUESTIONS ANSWERED.

TOWN HALL ANNOUNCEMENT:

WHO: COMMISSIONER KOWAL (R-DIST. 4) AND REP. BENARROCH (R-DIST. 81)
WHEN: WEDNESDAY AUGUST 13, 2025 5:30PM–6:30PM
WHERE: NAPLES REGIONAL LIBRARY
650 CENTRAL AVE. NAPLES, FL 34102
HOW: RSVP JAMIE.MERCHANT@FLHOUSE.GOV

BRING YOUR VOICE, BRING YOUR PROTEST SIGN, BRING NOISE MAKERS FUN OUTFITS IN CASE WE CAN'T GET IN
raw_summary: The flyer advertises a town hall meeting focused on community and environmental issues, offering attendees the chance to voice concerns and seek answers from Commissioner Kowal and Rep. Benaroch. The event is scheduled for August 13, 2025, at the Naples Regional Library in Florida.

title: Families Belong Together
description: Join us for a march, rally, and Latin Dance Fundraiser for families impacted by ICE.
raw_text: Families Belong Together! End the Separations! Join us for a march, rally, & Latin Dance Fundraiser for families impacted by ICE! Saturday, August 16. 8 PM. Elizabeth Caruthers Park, 3508 S Moody Ave.
raw_summary: The image is a flyer for an event titled 'Families Belong Together.' The event includes a march, rally, and a Latin Dance Fundraiser. It is targeted at supporting families impacted by ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement).

title: Indivisible ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’ Townhall

Alton Center, Good Shepherd Lutheran Church
2925 Old Missouri Rd. Fayetteville
MISSING PERSONS

Seating limited - First Come, first serve

raw_summary: An event titled 'Indivisible ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’ Townhall' will take place on Saturday, August 16th, from 1-3 p.m. at the Alton Center, Good Shepherd Lutheran Church, located at 2925 Old Missouri Rd., Fayetteville. The flyer indicates that seating is limited and no protest signs are allowed. Contact information is provided through an email.

title: Come Together NOCO
description: We invite families to enjoy food, resources, games, and activities while getting involved in the local community.
raw_text: FREE FAMILY FUN COMMUNITY BLOCK PARTY ENJOY FOOD, RESOURCES, GAMES, AND ACTIVITIES WHILE GETTING INVOLVED IN YOUR LOCAL COMMUNITY COME TOGETHER NOCO SUNDAY AUGUST 17TH 12:00PM-5:00PM CITY PARK: FORT COLLINS, CO FUTURE ANNOUNCEMENTS COMING SOON: LOCAL COMMUNITY GROUPS, EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS, AND ENTERTAINMENT LINEUPS FOR MORE DETAILS, CONTACT US: STANDUPNOCO@GMAIL.COM
raw_summary: The image promotes a community block party titled 'Come Together NOCO', offering food, games, and activities. It is scheduled for Sunday, August 17th, from 12:00 PM to 5:00 PM at City Park, Fort Collins, CO. The flyer encourages local community involvement.

title: Benefits Over Billionaires

title: Workers Over Billionaires
description: We are organizing an event on Labor Day to emphasize the importance of workers over billionaires. Our aim is to foster nonviolent action and reduce potential confrontations with those with differing values.
raw_text:
LABOR DAY, MONDAY, SEPT. 1, 2025
2PM
1N. MAIN STREET, BRIGHAM CITY
WORKERS OVER BILLIONAIRES
Indivisible Box Elder
A CORE PRINCIPLE BEHIND ALL INDIVISIBLE EVENTS IS A COMMITMENT TO NONVIOLENT ACTION. WE EXPECT ALL PARTICIPANTS TO SEEK TO DE-ESCALATE ANY POTENTIAL CONFRONTATION WITH THOSE WHO DISAGREE WITH OUR VALUES.
raw_summary: Event on Labor Day, September 1, 2025, at 2 PM at 1N. Main Street, Brigham City, organized by Indivisible Box Elder, focuses on prioritizing workers over billionaires with an emphasis on nonviolent action.
